title: Electric field - charge moving between isolines

content.question: A particle of charge <math alttext="q" overflow="scroll"><mi>q</mi></math> and mass <math alttext="m" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math> is in a region where there is an electric field. Some of the equipotential lines in this field are shown in the diagram. The electric potential at points <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> and <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> are <math alttext="V sub A" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>V</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub></math> and <math alttext="V sub B" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>V</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></msub></math>, respectively. The particle is released from rest at Point <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>, and it travels to Point <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>. Which of the following expressions correctly describe the speed of the particle at Point <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="the square root of the fraction with numerator 2 times the absolute value of q V sub A, end absolute value, and denominator m" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msqrt><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mrow><mo>|</mo><mi>q</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>|</mo></mrow></mrow><mi>m</mi></mfrac></msqrt></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the square root of the fraction with numerator 2 times the absolute value of q V sub B, end absolute value, and denominator m" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msqrt><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mrow><mo>|</mo><mi>q</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo>|</mo></mrow></mrow><mi>m</mi></mfrac></msqrt></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the square root of the fraction with numerator 2 q times, open parenthesis, V sub A, end sub, minus V sub B, close parenthesis, and denominator m" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msqrt><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>q</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mi>m</mi></mfrac></msqrt></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="2 times, the square root of the fraction with numerator q times, open parenthesis, V sub A, end sub, minus V sub B, close parenthesis, and denominator m" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>2</mn><msqrt><mfrac><mrow><mi>q</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mi>m</mi></mfrac></msqrt></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the square root of the fraction with numerator 2 q times, open parenthesis, V sub A, end sub, minus V sub B, close parenthesis, and denominator m" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msqrt><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>q</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mi>m</mi></mfrac></msqrt></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
